text: Hi, I have a 3 dimensional Vector{Vector{Vector{Int8}}} and I want to get a martrix by summing across first dimension

elements.text: Hi, I have a 3 dimensional Vector{Vector{Vector{Int8}}} and I want to get a martrix by summing across first dimension

text: You probably want to work with an `Array{Int8, 3}` instead of nested vectors. Then you can just use `sum(x, dims=1)`

text:
So I had a loop like this
```sum([[lookup[c] for c in m] for m in motifs])```
and I converted that to
```sum([hcat([lookup[c] for c in m]...) for m in motifs])```
lookup is a dictionary with one-hot vectors, this is just a convenient way to calculate frequencies I think of letters in dna alphabet across equal length motifs. I am not sure if this is best way though.

elements.text: So I had a loop like this
sum([[lookup[c] for c in m] for m in motifs])
sum([hcat([lookup[c] for c in m]...) for m in motifs])

lookup is a dictionary with one-hot vectors, this is just a convenient way to calculate frequencies I think of letters in dna alphabet across equal length motifs. I am not sure if this is best way though.
